item.title: Nathan add a quote by Fanny Howe
item.description: "The wildness of the flower is all in the tone" -- Fanny Howe

item.title: Nathan add a quote by James Wright
item.description: "In a pine tree,/ A few yards from my window sill,/ A brilliant blue jay is springing up and down, up and/ down./ On a branch./ I laugh, as I see him abandon himself/ To entire delight, for he knows as well as I do/ That the branch will not break." -- James Wright

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Townes Van Zandt
item.description: "The sky is full of silver and gold./ Try to hide the sun./ It can't be done./ Least not for long." -- Townes Van Zandt

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "In the fury of the moment/ I can see the Master's hand In every leaf that trembles, in/ every grain of sand." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Happiness, not in another place but this place...not for another hour, but this hour." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Nathan add a quote by George Oppen
item.description: "Among days// Having only the force/ Of days//Most simple/ Most difficult" -- George Oppen

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Virgil
item.description: "I will be gone from here and sing my songs/ In the forest wilderness where the wild beasts are,/ And carve in letters on the little trees/ The story of my love, and as the trees/ Will grow letters too will grow, to cry/ In a louder voice the story of my love." -- Virgil

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Guy Davenport
item.description: "The meaning of the world, said Wittgenstein, is outside the world. Events and values are distinguishable only in relation to others. A totality of events and values, the world itself, requires another." -- Guy Davenport

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Guy Davenport
item.description: "Something of the previous state, however, survives every change. This is called in the language of cybernetics (which took it form the language of machines) feedback, the advantages of learning from experience and of having developed reflexes." -- Guy Davenport

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Nothing matter but the quality/ of the affection—/in the end—that has carved the trace in the mind dove sta memoria" -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ezra Pounds
item.description: "Things have ends (or scopes) and beginnings. To/ know what precedes and what follows will assist yr/ comprehension of process." -- Ezra Pounds

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Nothing in nature is exhausted in its first use...In God, every end is converted into a new means." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The ruin or blank, that we see when we look at nature is in our own eye...Love is as much its demand, as perception. Indeed neither can be perfect without the other." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every word was once a poem." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by William Bartram
item.description: "All nature awakes to life and activity." -- William Bartram

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ronald Johnson
item.description: "Sounds come/ to the ear,// transformed." -- Ronald Johnson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Robert Smithson
item.description: "The word ‘color’ means at its origin to ‘cover’ or ‘hide.’ Matter eats up light and ‘covers’ it with a confusion of color." -- Robert Smithson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Andrew Marvell
item.description: "To wander solitary there: Two paradises ‘twere in one To live in paradise alone." -- Andrew Marvell
